Apple___Apple_scab.chemical: Spray Captan 50% WP or Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2 g/litre.
Apple___Apple_scab.biological: Apply Bacillus subtilis and remove fallen infected leaves.

Apple___Black_rot.chemical: Use Thiophanate-methyl or Carbendazim during early season.
Apple___Black_rot.biological: Prune infected limbs; apply Trichoderma in the soil.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.chemical: Apply Myclobutanil or Sulfur sprays during early leaf stage.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.biological: Remove alternate host junipers to break the cycle.

Rice___Brown_Spot.biological: Apply Pseudomonas fluorescens @ 10 ml/litre at booting stage.

Rice___Leaf_Blast.chemical: Use Tricyclazole 75% WP @ 0.6 g/litre at initial infection.
Rice___Leaf_Blast.biological: Spray Pseudomonas fluorescens and maintain field hygiene.

Rice___Neck_Blast.chemical: Apply Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1 g/litre at panicle emergence.
Rice___Neck_Blast.biological: Use mixed formulation of Pseudomonas fluorescens and Bacillus subtilis.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.chemical: Apply Copper oxychloride 50% WP @ 3 g/litre of water every 7–10 days.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.biological: Use Pseudomonas fluorescens as seed and foliar spray to suppress infection.

Tomato___Early_blight.chemical: Spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2 g/litre or Chlorothalonil 75% WP.
Tomato___Early_blight.biological: Apply Trichoderma viride as soil amendment and foliar spray.

Tomato___Late_blight.chemical: Apply Metalaxyl + Mancozeb mixture @ 2.5 g/litre at 7-day intervals.
Tomato___Late_blight.biological: Use Bacillus subtilis or Trichoderma harzianum for biocontrol.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.chemical: Use Azoxystrobin or Copper fungicides at early stages of infection.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.biological: Maintain good airflow; use Neem oil 3% as foliar spray.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.chemical: Apply Chlorothalonil 75% WP or Mancozeb at 10-day intervals.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.biological: Use compost teas and Bacillus-based biofungicides.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.biological: Use neem oil or predatory mites like Phytoseiulus persimilis.

Tomato___Target_Spot.chemical: Apply Azoxystrobin or Difenoconazole at early stage.
Tomato___Target_Spot.biological: Use compost tea sprays and ensure proper spacing for airflow.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.biological: Use yellow sticky traps and neem oil to reduce vector population.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.chemical: No direct chemical; remove infected plants and disinfect tools.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.biological: Use resistant varieties; apply seaweed extracts to boost immunity.

Tomato___healthy.biological: To be updated: Recommended biological treatment or bio-fungicide.

Wheat___Brown_Rust.biological: Remove volunteer wheat plants; use Trichoderma bioagents.

Wheat___Yellow_Rust.chemical: Spray Propiconazole 25% EC @ 1 ml/litre of water.
Wheat___Yellow_Rust.biological: Use Neem-based fungicides and resistant cultivars.
